types.html:
neige artificielle f (plural neiges artificielles)

  1. a type of water ice based artificial snow produced by snow cannons, where water is sprayed into the bath of a highspeed airstream produced by a highpower high-capacity fan
  2. fake snow; a snow substitute that is not composed of water ice, typically used for decorative purposes, frequently in room temperature environments

Hypernyms

[edit]
  • neige

Coordinate terms

[edit]
  • canon à neige
  • neige de culture (“another type of water ice artificial snow”)
  • neige naturelle
